China introduced new anti-money laundering rules in August 2025 to cut down on large anonymous purchases of precious metals, but criminals have adapted by breaking down transactions into smaller amounts or shifting operations to Dubai and Singapore. Regulators have responded with stricter rules to close loopholes. Compliance technology and ESG-aligned gold funds are becoming more popular.
